section.title: OpenStack Security Advisory OSSA-2017-001
section.para: The OpenStack Security Advisory OSSA-2017-001 which describes CVE-2017-2592 was released on January 26, 2017. It discloses a security defect which causes Keystone tokens to be logged when a Neutron API call encounters unexpected error conditions. When this happens, the log entry that contains the token is propagated to the centralized logging facility. The result is that anyone with access to the centralized logging facility or the local log file containing the token could use the token to impersonate the owner of the token until the token expires. Tokens expire in 4 hours by default. Neutron is the only &kw-hos; service affected by this issue. The error conditions which cause this token to leak into the logs are not expected to happen frequently. However, customers should be aware of this risk. Customers may wish to further limit the access to the centralized logging facility and watch for suspicious activity that could indicate usage of a stolen Keystone token to impersonate another user. The Keystone token timeout value could also be changed but it is not recommended; testing would be required to ensure things still work in the customer environment if the token timeout value is reduced.

section.title: &kw-hos; Directory Umask
section.para: &kw-hos; directory umask is 0022. Changing this value may cause unstable internal communication in the &kw-hos; product and will negatively affect upgrade.

section.title: Adding Top-Level Domains with Designate
section.para: In &kw-hos-phrase; and earlier ( with designate V2.0.1 ) when using Designate to add Top-Level Domains (that controls who can create zones), there is a caching defect. When an entry is made to the tld list (openstack tld create --name abc.net), in order to take effect the designate-central on all the controllers needs to be restarted.

section.title: Adding New Flavors After Upgrade
section.para: After upgrading to &kw-hos-phrase; from &kw-hos-phrase; 4.0 you may experience an error when attempting to add new flavors.
Example:
section.screen:
$ openstack flavor create --ram 512 --vcpus 1 --disk 0 --ephemeral 0 --swap 0 --public m1.tinystu
Not all flavors have been migrated to the API database (HTTP 409) (Request-ID: req-bdae0a10-e6c3-42d4-9a58-b4438fcc4309)
section.para: This is caused by the time fields associated with the flavor not being updated correctly. You can view the time fields by selecting all from the instance_types table in the nova mysql database.
The time fields created_at, updated_at or deleted_at may have invalid dates or not all of the fields are NULL.
To resolve the new flavors issues the time fields must all be set to NULL.
Once the tables are updated, exit mysql and run the following command.
You can now create a new flavors in &kw-hos-phrase;.

section.title: Vertica Log Rotation
section.para: Vertica database logs are not rotated automatically for non-primary cluster nodes. As a result, Vertica logs on those nodes may grow continuously, eventually filling the filesystem to its capacity. This issue can be patched by logging into each node with Vertica installed and run the following command.
section.screen: echo -e '#!/bin/sh logrotate /opt/vertica/config/logrotate_base.conf' | sudo tee /etc/cron.daily/vertica-logrotate; sudo chmod 755 /etc/cron.daily/vertica-logrotate
section.para: While this step is not necessary on the Vertica cluster's primary node, it is also not harmful. This command is idempotent and future-proof with regard to upgrading to later &kw-hos; versions.

section.title: VPNaaS does not support SHA-384 and SHA-512
section.para: The VPNaaS plugin limits the ipsec and ike auth algorithm to SHA-1 and SHA-256. If you attempt to add a new driver (for example, a hardware VPN gateway), and the new driver supports additional auth algorithm, such as SHA2-384, SHA2-512, it cannot be integrated with the current VPNaaS plugin.

section.title: Manual Cleaning
section.para: Manual Cleaning (Raid Configuration) is not supported if the target disk type is SATA SSD.

section.title: Transparent VLAN
section.para: In &kw-hos-phrase; Transparent VLAN is not supported.

section.title: Disaster Recovery Panel
section.para: Although the Disaster Recovery panel can be viewed when logged in as an admin user, only the hlm_backup user is the supported user of this feature. The admin user is unable to view the default backup jobs or create new jobs. Therefore, all backup and recovery actions should be performed only when logged in as the hlm_backup user.

section.title: Attaching a volume with Device Name in Horizon
section.para: In Horizon the screen for attaching a volume to an instance requires a Device Name. This field is editable but cannot be empty or it will revert to the default value.
To attach a volume to an instance without specifying a Device Name, use the command line (CLI).

section.title: Ironic: ILO Firmware
section.para: In &kw-hos-phrase; the ILO Firmware version needs to be minimum 2.30 for agent_ilo driver.

section.title: Ironic 'shreading' (cleaning) may take a long time depending on the disk size/performance.
section.para: During deployment, with automated_cleaning set to True and when the Nova instance is deleted, it may take an unusually long time to finish or may even seem as though it's hung depending on the disk performance/size.

section.title: Ironic Multi-Tenancy Conversion
section.para: Ironic Multi-tenancy is only supported as a fresh install of &kw-hos-phrase;. An existing Ironic flat environment to multi-tenancy environment conversion is not supported.

section.title: Do not enable HEAT Auditing
section.para: Audit log is disabled by default and cannot be enabled due to a Keystone middleware defect in Newton.

section.title: Ops Console Notification Panel
section.para: If there are no Alarm notification methods configured, the Ops Console notifications tab will not allow creation of new notification methods. It is recommended to not delete the default notification method if no other methods have been created.
You can work around this issue by creating a new notification method using the Monasca command-line, after which the UI will function again.

section.title: LBaaS
section.para: LBaaS Hot-Plugin is not supported with DPDK.
LBaaS load_balancer_expiry_age value in the housekeeping section of the configuration for octavia-housekeeping service needs to be configured appropriately to the default value=604800.

section.title: F5 Loadbalancer Support
section.para: If you are planning to upgrade from &kw-hos-phrase; 3.0 or &kw-hos-phrase; 4.0, please contact F5 and HPE PointNext to determine which F5 drivers have been certified for use with Helion OpenStack. Loading drivers not certified by HPE may result in catastrophic failure of your cloud deployment. The last tested versions are 8.0.8 for &kw-hos; 3.x and 9.0.3 for &kw-hos; 4.x . More information is expected in 4th quarter 2017, including the correct drivers for &kw-hos; 5.x.

section.title: Persistent failures during the early phase of boot
section.para: If you are experiencing intermittent or persistent failures during the early phase of boot process for certain classes of machines (e.g. DL360 Gen8 and DL160 Gen9), the likely issue is DHCP timeouts due to slow convergence of STP.

You can work around this issue by enabling rapid spanning tree protocol on the switch. If this is not an option due to conservative loop detection strategies, rebuild ipxe images with higher DHCP timeouts, or alternatively maintain link status to the server NICs during power cycles.

section.para: Swarm cluster is not support behind a proxy even with -http(s)-proxy parameters specified.

section.para: The command line (CLI) cmd, swift-init is not supported. To start/stop Swift use the Ansible playbooks, swift-start.yml and swift-stop.yml.

section.para: Live Migration from non-HLinux nodes including SLES nodes to HLinux nodes are not supported.
